modName: Additional Player Voices for Skyrim - Voice Packs
summary: Voice packs for the Additional Player Voices Mod. Currently there are three male voice sets: Angry Fighter, Villain, and Brash.
descriptionHtml:
[color=yellow]This mod is officially discontinued.[/color]

Voice packs for the Additional Player Voices Mod. They're a bit limited in scope and are really meant for battle. Generally you might think your character shouldn't be talking too much when they're all by their lonesome, right?

Requirements:
[color=red]
You MUST have [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/21215]Additional Player Voices for Skyrim[/url] installed for this to function.[/color]
[color=green]
Hearthfire + Dawnguard are NOT necessary for this mod to function and should be fully compatible.[/color]

[color=purple]If you are kind enough to make a video for me, I'll gladly place it here on the page so people can get a preview of the voices. I lack the proper video editing skills to do it myself. [/color]
Current Packs:
Males:
Very Angry Fighter (Berserker/Fighter)
Villain (Any archetype so long as they seem evil would make sense.)
Brash Adventurer (Sounds almost like a leprechaun....)

- You may only have one installed at a time. Swapping between two voices may require you to uninstall your current one first and then install the new one via the manager if for some reason you install a new one and the voice doesn't change.


More to come!

Installation
Nexus Mod Manager:
Just download and activate! Using this method you can also easily swap between voice packs for characters (once they're available, duh.)

Manually:
1.Extract the archive.
2.Merge the data folder with your Skyrim Data folder.


[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Mikhos/]Contact Me[/url]
Or send me a message, leave a comment, whatever floats your boat.


Other voice packs to check out:
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24630] MORE Additional Player Voices for Skyrim by gawan[/url] His voice packs have sounds for most context situations. That means your character should have something to say about all the things you do.
author: EonDriftor
